title: 陈俊杰
text:
I am Jack Chen, a freshman who contacted a year of programming, and also a video creator.（Believe me, the two are somehow related） 
Now I working in the team of a Harvard postdoc. I have been exposed to many technology stacks, including R, Python, SQL, and container technologies for docker, Tableau and PowerBI for business intelligence visualization and so on. I’ve also been working to promote these tool technologies to more people, and I believe that the process of sharing makes me more proficient with these technologies. That’s why I became a bilibili video creator.
Thanks to this identity, I started to accumulate my own fans, so I organized a community, which allowed me to meet more people who are specialized in big data or interested in it. From time to time, I also invite bigwigs in the industry to share their experiences with us. I think these are very meaningful things, both to make more people like programming, and to spur myself to work harder!

title: 陈俊杰
text:
Bio
I’m a PhD candidate at SUNY-ESF, working on predictive modeling and visualization with a focus on natural systems. My current work focuses on using game engines as GIS to visualize large-scale landscapes with a focus on forested systems as a method for scientific communication and outreach. Past projects have focused on landscape and community ecology, and have included predictive models of forest biomass from remote sensing data and the landscape-level impacts of beaver within New York’s Adirondack State Park. In all of these projects I’ve worked to apply data science techniques to large-scale challenges, frequently serving as the statistical and technical expert within my team.

title: 陈俊杰
text:
Education
State University of New York College of Environmental Science and Forestry
Syracuse, NY
Ph.D. in Environmental Science | August 2020 - Present (Expected 2024)
B.S. in Forest Ecosystem Science | August 2015 - December 2018
